newsitem.title: USA: VeriFone wins approval for software export.
newsitem.headline: VeriFone wins approval for software export.

text.p: VeriFone Inc on Wednesday said the U.S. Department of Commerce will allow it to export Secure Electronic Transaction (SET) software, marking the first highly encrypted, Internet-based commerce software the government has approved for overseas.
VeriFone's SET-based products are designed for use by financial institutions, merchants and consumers to conduct secure Internet credit card transactions.

"Being a vendor to receive such approval will give VeriFone a significant advantage in the marketplace to deliver secure SET-based solutions around the world in a timely manner," George Hoyem, general manager of the Internet Commerce Division, said in a statement.
